this is a very large amount of changes to our requirements.txt. Can this be stacked into smaller changes. I'd like each change to run through our load testing 

Could you stack 2-3 prs for this @Jacobh2 ?

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -1,49 +1,48 @@
 # LITELLM PROXY DEPENDENCIES #
 anyio==4.4.0 # openai + http req.
-openai==1.40.0 # openai req.
discussion_comments.comment_body: For sure! Any particular grouping you have in mind?
why is the google sdk being bumped in this PR?

The bump in opentelemetry requirements to support the incubating semantic conventions requires protobuf >=5.0. google-cloud-aiplatform needed a bump to allow for protobuf > 5. In digging for a supported version for this comment, it looks like 1.61 is the first version that allows for protobuf 5. I've updated the version in the latest commit
https://github.com/googleapis/python-aiplatform/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#1610-2024-08-05 - Changelog with the protobuf version bump

Hey @keith-decker - thanks for the quick response. Since we don't use google's sdk for handling calls - is there a reason we need protobuf bumped?

Trying to understand what could be using protobuf here. 

Bumping the sdk might have other consequences, so just trying to make sure we really need to do it.

Understandable, I just could not install all the requirements using `pip install -r requirements.txt` because of the conflicting protobuf requirements. 

I did that in order to install everything for `make unit-test` to function. If I was doing that incorrectly, I'll be happy to back off the requirements change.
try reverting it, and see if it passes the unit tests on ci/cd - if so, then i think we can back off the change. Since I can't imagine why OTEL would need protobuf.
